I haven't seen this mentioned anywhere, but if you're on mobile and need to access the "full" editor features (and they're not visible), rotate your phone from portrait mode to landscape mode. If your landscape is wide enough pixel-wise the "full" editor will appear when the page repaints. (Yay responsive design?!)

Or at least it works for iOS 9.1 on an iPhone 5.

I'm having an issue with quotes, and I'm wondering if you smart people in this thread have figured out a solution.

Often I would like to quote only the specific part of a post that I am replying to - one or two sentences are usually more than enough to establish context. However, the WYSIWYG editor will not allow me to edit quote contents. I can either quote the whole post, or don't quote it at all.

Now, I know there's this functionality where you use your mouse to highlight a text passage in a post and get offered the option to quote it. So far, so good. That approach is useless, however, if you want to do any of the following:

- Use the multiquote button to quote multiple posts at once
- Quote multiple, unrelated parts of a longer post
- Add a quote to a post you are already in the process of writing
- Especially if the soure post is on the previous page of the thread

The old BBCode editor had absolutely zero issues in this regard, but since we're not getting that one back: what would you guys recommend I do to deal with this?

I've seen complaints about changing tables after the initial creation. You can bring the table dialog back up by using CTRL+Right-Click on the table. Then you can go back and modify it to your liking. Also, if you hover your mouse over the various options, it'll tell you valid inputs. For example, you don't have to specify width in pixels. You can use "100%" and it fills the screen. That makes me wonder if that's also the problem with folks using mobile devices (fixed pixels are bad for that).
